intro: Phoradendron wattii, commonly known as the wattii mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and white, sticky berries. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have a significant impact on the health and growth of its host trees.
